title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 65.43 - Hearing officer; duties and powers
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 65.43 - Hearing officer; duties and powers

State Regulations
(a) A hearing in any proceeding may be
conducted by one or more Board members or an employee of the Board designated
and delegated the authority by the Board as a hearing officer. Any member or
employee of the Board designated and delegated the authority to conduct a
hearing or investigation shall possess those powers and duties mentioned and
described in section
65.42, unless otherwise designated
by the Board. (b) At any time, a
hearing officer may be designated and delegated the authority by the Board to
take the place of a person or persons previously designated to conduct a
hearing. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
65.43

Adopted

New

York State Register March 30, 2022/Volume XLIV, Issue 13, eff. 3/30/2022

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
